description: Retrieves the list of the data lake administrators of a Lake Formation-managed data lake.

nested_items.name: DataLakeSettings
nested_items.description: A structure representing a list of Lake Formation principals designated as data lake administrators.

nested_items.name: DataLakeAdmins
nested_items.description: A list of Lake Formation principals. Supported principals are IAM users or IAM roles.

nested_items.name: DataLakePrincipalIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for the Lake Formation principal.

nested_items.name: ReadOnlyAdmins
nested_items.description: A list of Lake Formation principals with only view access to the resources, without the ability to make changes. Supported principals are IAM users or IAM roles.

nested_items.name: DataLakePrincipalIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for the Lake Formation principal.

nested_items.name: CreateDatabaseDefaultPermissions
nested_items.description: Specifies whether access control on newly created database is managed by Lake Formation permissions or exclusively by IAM permissions.

nested_items.name: Principal
nested_items.description: The principal who is granted permissions.

nested_items.name: DataLakePrincipalIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for the Lake Formation principal.

nested_items.name: Permissions
nested_items.description: The permissions that are granted to the principal.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CreateTableDefaultPermissions
nested_items.description: Specifies whether access control on newly created table is managed by Lake Formation permissions or exclusively by IAM permissions.

nested_items.name: Principal
nested_items.description: The principal who is granted permissions.

nested_items.name: DataLakePrincipalIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for the Lake Formation principal.

nested_items.name: Permissions
nested_items.description: The permissions that are granted to the principal.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: A key-value map that provides an additional configuration on your data lake. CROSS_ACCOUNT_VERSION is the key you can configure in the Parameters field. Accepted values for the CrossAccountVersion key are 1, 2, 3, and 4.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TrustedResourceOwners
nested_items.description: A list of the resource-owning account IDs that the caller's account can use to share their user access details (user ARNs). The user ARNs can be logged in the resource owner's CloudTrail log.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AllowExternalDataFiltering
nested_items.description: Whether to allow Amazon EMR clusters to access data managed by Lake Formation.

nested_items.name: AllowFullTableExternalDataAccess
nested_items.description: Whether to allow a third-party query engine to get data access credentials without session tags when a caller has full data access permissions.

nested_items.name: ExternalDataFilteringAllowList
nested_items.description: A list of the account IDs of Amazon Web Services accounts with Amazon EMR clusters that are to perform data filtering.>

nested_items.name: DataLakePrincipalIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for the Lake Formation principal.

nested_items.name: AuthorizedSessionTagValueList
nested_items.description: Lake Formation relies on a privileged process secured by Amazon EMR or the third party integrator to tag the user's role while assuming it. Lake Formation will publish the acceptable key-value pair, for example key = 'LakeFormationTrustedCaller' and value = 'TRUE' and the third party integrator must properly tag the temporary security credentials that will be used to call Lake Formation's administrative APIs.
(string) ---
